Name: Licensing newsstands.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to licensing newsstands.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

Section 1.  Section 20-231 of Chapter 2 of title 20 of the administrative code of the city of New York is hereby amended by adding a new subdivision l, to read as follows:
l.	Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, a new license may be granted for the operation of a newsstand that is attached to or is abutting a building, and was in continuous operation from November 1, 1979 to October 29, 2003 provided that all of the following conditions are met prior to the grant of such license : (i) such newsstand complies with the existing Fire Code: 
	(ii) such newsstand does not extend further into the street than stooplines of such adjoining or abutting building or stooplines that are within twenty-five feet of such newsstand;
(iii) the Department of Transportation and a franchisee have consented to the inclusion of such newsstand in a franchise.
Â§2. This local law shall take effect immediately.
 



LS 2944/2007
ASP
12/13/07
